title:
**Yuanxu Dong, PhD**
Humboldt postdoc fellowship
text:
ECR in Marine Science



Air-sea gas exchange


Ocean carbon cycle


Eddy covariance







Hi there!


I am a postdoc with a Humboldt Fellowship at GEOMAR (Chemical Oceanography) and Heidelberg University (Institute of Environmental Physics).


My research focuses on air-sea gas exchange and the ocean carbon cycle. I use field observations, laboratory experiments, and modeling to investigate factors that influence air-sea gas exchange, including bubbles, surfactants, and the cool skin, and to scale these effects to improve estimates of the ocean carbon sink.


I have over 10 years of experience applying the eddy covariance technique to measure air-sea fluxes of momentum, heat, and COâ‚‚.






Upcoming events



1-4 March 2026: Visit University of East Anglia, Norwich.


21-28 February 2026: Ocean Science Meeting, Glasgow. Looking forward to catching up.



Recent Updates



February 2026: MSCA Postdoctoral Fellowship 2025: scored 96.6 (grant 96.8) â€“ on the reserve list, disappointing, yet still smiling with the Seal of Excellence ðŸ˜„


February 2026: Selected to co-chair the SOLAS Early Career Scientist Committee (ECSC) for 2026-2028


January 2026: Invited to be an editor of the EGU journal Earth Observation



Contact


RD 2 - Chemical Oceanography GEOMAR Helmholtz Centre for Ocean Research Kiel, WischhofstraÃŸe 1-3, 24148 Kiel ydong@geomar.de
